description.value:
When you cast a spell that targets only one creature and doesn't have a range of self, you can spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level to target a second creature in range with the same spell (1 sorcery point if the spell is a cantrip).

To be eligible, a spell must be incapable of targeting more than one creature at the spell's current level. For example, @Compendium[5e-complete.5e-spells.BOe1B6ePOv94bvE7]{Magic Missile} and @Compendium[5e-complete.5e-spells.brFqMN9eI91GFIhv]{Scorching Ray} aren't eligible, but @Compendium[5e-complete.5e-spells.Sl2KPM6B6xeKK6gn]{Ray of Frost} and @Compendium[5e-complete.5e-spells.BpYESwXBLQUwX8jc]{Chromatic Orb} are.

Note: Perform manually; there is no macro to automate this yet.

activation.condition: When you cast a spell that targets only one creature and doesn't have a range of self

magicitems.destroyFlavorText: reaches 0 charges: it crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.
